Text.Value: Home? What home?!
This world gives you so much - you must fight for it. You know this is your duty.
Never turn your back on a predator you don't understand. Running now won't save you.
Die a warrior's death, or die a coward - running, pissing your little breeches. Choose.
One last run. Then we're clear.
Oh, you think this is scary? Wait until you see what I do if you leave. That will be scary.
If you leave now, I will hunt you down as the cowards you are. Your choice.
Run if you must, it will not help. You will be judged, and your soul will be forfeit.
*Can the rumours be true? Are you the mind flayer who could save the city?*
*He's frightened of you, but the very fact that you haven't killed him on sight gives him reason to pause.*
Running would be futile, this is exactly what will happen if illithids take Baldur's Gate...
If you leave now, the brain will kill you anyway, and turn you into its slaves. Fight with us, for your own salvation.
Let your patron run their magic through these guards - convince them to stay.
Fall back! Fall back!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: City watch guards (6) fleeing in a panic towards us, their unit leader yelling to his men.

Text.Value: City Watch - with me! We'll follow you. To our last breaths.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: First sentence to other guards, second sentence to player.

Text.Value: Once I burn these aberrations to dust, I will turn my ire on any who ran on this day.
You should come with us.
Stay and fight - even if you die here, you will die a martyr. Your soul lauded forever.
*You feel his mind buckling, yielding - against his better judgement, he trusts you.*
*There's a glimmer of something beyond his words, but in a moment its gone, consumed with fear.*
My men have seen enough.
Matthew!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: One of the city watch reaches forward in grief towards his fallen comrade.

Text.Value: The fires of adversity forge the most noble heroes. Stand by your city. Stand by your people.
Is this how the City Watch valiantly defends its home?
Is this how the City Watch valiantly defends its home?
*In all his fear, he longed only for this - the freedom of an ultimatum.*
Get out of here.
Get out of here.
Leave him be - we have to keep running.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: First guard forcibly urges him away.

Text.Value: *His words say that he's given up, but buried deep behind them is a fragment of hope. He doesn't want it to be over any more than you do.*
I'm sorry. We can't - I'm sorry.
*You see his mind racing through its options, finding only one. Against all his better judgement, it's you and your mind flayer.*
It's not too late. Fight with us. For Baldur's Gate.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: A psionic blast from a mind flayer obliterates two of the city watch to dust.

Text.Value: I'm sorry.
Shit. If this is it, then godsdammit, let's make it count.

EditorData.NodeContext: reconciling themself with almost certain death - sadness as they do so

Text.Value: You're running the wrong way.
You're running the wrong way.
I'm not like other mind flayers. I'm here to save you. Fight with me.
This mind flayer is not like the others. This one will save you. Fight with us.
What's happening here?
What's happening here?
Argh. We go back in there, we die. We flee, we last half a day at best...
While the High Hall stands, you've no right to leave. Get back to your duty - fight.
If you leave now, the brain will kill you anyway, and turn you into its slaves. You may as well fight with me. For your own salvation.
*Can the rumours be true? Is this really the mind flayer who could save the city?*
Mind flayer... Mind flayer!
Join us, or I'll set the mind flayer on you.
You knew the risk when you signed your sword arm to protect this city. Stay.
Join me in the fight against the brain or I'll turn you into a thrall right now.
Can't you see?
Remarkable... never in all my life did I think... To fight alongside a mind flayer...?

EditorData.NodeContext: pondering the impossible in a new light, but not without its edge of desperation

Text.Value: Gladly.
*He's frightened of your illithid ally, but the very fact that it hasn't killed him on sight gives him reason to pause.*
If you leave now, the brain will kill you anyway, and turn you into its slaves. You may as well fight with me. For your own salvation.
When legends recall this day - will you be a valiant sentinel or a cowering runaway?
To the victor go the spoils - the Duke said anything you find while fighting, you get to keep.
Fear is natural right now. But still your heart, focus your mind. Stay - fight - win.
No right? Our lives are our right!
Run, friends. Run!
While the High Hall stands, you've no right to leave. Get back to your duty - fight.
It's over.
This mind flayer is my thrall. Fight with us, and we'll defeat the brain together.

Synopsis: As players reach the High Hall, they run into the last remnants of the city guard and have a chance to persuade them to stay and fight.
